benchmark_details.name: MoCa: Measuring Human-Language Model Alignment on Causal and Moral Judgment Tasks
benchmark_details.overview: The study investigates the alignment between human causal and moral judgments and those made by large language models (LLMs). It uses a dataset collected from cognitive science literature to evaluate how well LLMs emulate human reasoning in scenarios involving causal and moral judgment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and understand the alignment of language models with human intuitions regarding causal and moral judgments.
audience: researchers in the fields of AI and ethics
tasks: evaluate LLM performance on causal and moral judgment tasks
identify implicit tendencies in model judgments

data.annotation: Expert annotation on latent factors influencing judgments

methodology.calculation: Calculated using probabilities assigned to responses by LLMs compared to human judgments.
methodology.interpretation: The results indicate the degree to which LLMs align with human moral and causal judgments.
methodology.validation: Results validated through comparison against human responses and evaluation of annotation agreement.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personal data was collected from participants.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The dataset is under a Creative Commons license (CC BY 4.0).
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants were provided with consent forms at the beginning of the study.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study received IRB approval for ethical compliance.
